subject: Productivity
title: The Focus Block Method
description: A quick, practical guide to The Focus Block Method.

hook.text: Block 90 minutes. Silence the phone. Close the door. That's one focus block. Aim for two a day.

buildup.text: Ninety minutes aligns with the brain's ultradian rhythm â€” natural cycles of high and low alertness.

discovery.text: Research shows that 90 minutes of deep focus followed by a 20-minute break maximizes output.

twist.text: Most people never get one uninterrupted 90-minute block in a workday. The calendar fills with shallows.

climax.text: Protecting focus blocks requires saying no to interruptions proactively, not reactively.

punchline.text: Two deep blocks a day can outperform eight scattered hours.

quiz.question: How long is a focus block aligned with ultradian rhythms?
